data.title: Delamont Country Park
data.meta_description: Situated on the shores of Strangford Lough in an area of natural beauty, Delamont Country Park offers peace, beauty and tranquillity, stunning views across Strangford Lough and a relaxing atmosphere.&
data.text:
Situated on the shores of Strangford Lough in an area of natural beauty, Delamont Country Park offers peace, beauty and tranquillity, stunning views across Strangford Lough and a relaxing atmosphere. Delamont is a place to enjoy a ‘get away from it all’ feeling! Delamont is home to the Strangford Stone the tallest megalith in Ireland.

This beautiful 200 acre Country Park, offers a great day out for visitors of all ages. Whether you are a keen walker, a nature lover or simply looking for a great day out for all the family. Delamont Country Park has plenty to offer including:

5 Star award winning caravan and camping site (Camping and Caravan Club)

Beautiful, panoramic views across the Lough to the Mourne Mountains

Countryside walks, from 1km to 7km distance, along the shores of Strangford Lough, a mixture of coastal, parkland and woodland which are all inter linked, can be easily added to or shortened, start and finish from the main car park and are on flat and drumlin terrain

Horse riding

Licensed wedding venue

Mature woodland

Miniature Railway, 1km long with a Thomas the Tank Engine lookalike engine (seasonal)

Mobility Scooters free to hire. To use the mobility scooters you MUST be a member of Shop Mobility. It is FREE to become a member. To become a member and for further information please contact 028 9080 8090

Open areas for family picnics, BBQ area and games

Outdoor adventure playground

Room for hire

Steamers Coffee Shop

To experience a virtual reality 360 degree image of Delamont Country Park click here.

Opening Times

March and October: 9am - 6pm

April and September: 9am - 8pm

May to August: 9am - 9pm

November to February:* 9am - 5pm

*Closed Christmas Day

Vehicle Parking

From Monday 22 April 2024, there is a new car parking permit and charging system at our four main parks Slieve Gullion Forest Park, Kilbroney Park, Castlewellan Forest Park and Delamont Country Park.

FREE entry into one park of choice with a ‘single-park permit’ is available to each registered household address within the Newry, Mourne and Down District Council area.

Access to the park on foot or by bicycle is free. Clickhere for more details.

Miniature Railway

Enjoy a journey on our popular miniature railway. A fantastic treat for all the family!

Opening Times

September to Easter: Saturday & Sunday, 11am-4pm (Closed Monday-Friday)

Easter to September: Monday-Sunday, 11am-4pm

Admission: £2.50

Steamers Coffee Kiosk (Take away only)

Serving a variety of refreshments, tea, coffee and ice cream.

Opening Times

September to Easter: Saturday & Sunday, 11am-4pm (Closed Monday-Friday)

Easter to September: Monday-Sunday, 11am-4pm

Times for Coffee Kiosk & Miniature railway are subject to weather conditions. Please check Delamont Miniature Railway Facebook page for up to date information.

Directions

Delamont is located on the A22 Downpatrick to Comber Road, five minutes drive from Downpatrick.
